post.body: great book, Monk. Glad to hear you are a West Coast literateur.
yup, still do.
groan again
groan.
you, sir, need a Carolina girl.
"Singin' in the Rain." Also, just getting through is what the holidays are about here too.
you, my young friend, are too youthful to be a gram. How's the diss?
assumes I need to resolve something. What could that possibly be?
did physical labor for three hours this afternoon. Now I kn ow why I went to college. Labor is noble but thinking takes less energy.
back on the block after short twittercation. Lack of college football leaves me bloagy. But today, go Panthers and Steelers.
been un-twittered all day long. No reason, just not much to say. Been a day.
Hereby challenging AW, BR, and JE to write the best ELC dissertations EVER.
1200 in Laurinburg. http://tinyurl.com/5rkwyq
0845 thru Asheboro. Definitely felt the aura of @rice336.
0800 on the road to Carthage for a student visit. A beautiful day for it too.
2250 ready for the rack. Forecast for tomorrow--running around all over the southern Piedmont. Good times. Over and out.
1816 loveLee has abandoned me for dinner. Must make it on my own. Out to hunt down prey, skin and cook over an open fire. Perhaps also roar!
1734 finished with email clean-up. Waiting to hear from loveLee. Then dinner and book group. Busy day.
1600 on the way home to dig out of three days worth of emails
1400 off to Sumner to meet with teachers on the inclusive practice project. What a great day--even in the rain.
1328 time for lunch. At Elizabeth's for my fave comfort food lunch. Great research meetings this morning.
1010 off to campus for two student meetings
0900 on the clock at Sternberger Elem to visit with the principal
beginning to understand why students bring laptops to class. Has little to do with instruction and a lot to do with presentations.
interesting: FB & Twitter are uncluttered. Maybe normal people have better things to do on Saturday night. Me--electronically multi-tasking
start of what feels like a good Wintersession class today. Boo-yah, as they say.
"Shake it, shake it, shake it, Sugaree. Just don't tell 'em that you know me" Nobody like Garcia, man. No-bo-dy.
ready for a new day. All fired up about my WinterSession class. This could be the one!
Obama makes big mistake #1. Not amused. Equal rights are not special rights. Separate is inherently inequal.
finished with grading, ready for WinterSession, looking forward to Commencement, then it's catch-up time. The beat goes on . . . .
thinks if Joe Paterno can coach football until he's 85, I can profess until I'm 85. 25 more years of teaching and learning. Oh, yeah.
watching a Christmas NCIS. Seems a little odd.
twitter to Facebook is wearing me out. Don't they know I have better things to do than post status twice????????
apparently Twitter is not pushing to Facebook. OMG, what a crisis
working on my WinterSession class--shaping up to be one of my better efforts. As exciting as you can get about school law--pretty excited.
proceeding under the assumption that all will work out as planned."Guys and Dolls" on TV tonight--2nd best movie of all time.
Met with Mo. Impressive. Likes to get things done. My kind of guy.
0900 and it's already a crisis day. Bad moon rising?
Carlitude Life Rule #4: Pants first, then shoes.
one more day in sync with the principle of verticality. Call it a success.
when they built you, brother, they broke the mold--Bruce
Robert Plant and Alison Kraus, "Please Read the Letter" blue-country that rocks sad
just saw a woman in hair curlers in public. Been a long time since I saw that.
committed to a productive week. Yeah, really.
puzzled.
Reminiscing about WV coal camps with Drake. Reckon we are becoming old.
watching two teams about whom I care not one wit. . . because it's the playoffs and it's football.
High Noon--finishing a session with students for WinterSession. Now on to the playoffs.
Lee, Jesse, Kate after a great dinner at Dowlers. @ Dowlers http://loopt.us/sLVc4Q
Afternoon of day 2. Sun is peeking through. Still semi-working. Waitin for the world to change.
on to Day 2 of the new and improved @clashley. Semi-working today.
HNY everybody from all of us--@clashley, loveLee, Gilly, McC, Sam and Dave. 2009 is all good from here. Onward and Upward.
Big NYE plans--Elizabeth's baked ziti for dinner, Rachel Maddow at 11:00. According to India Arie, "There's hope." Happy and Progressive NY.
ready for some rack time. Tomorrow is a brand new day. The future starts tomorrow at noon, I declare.
Maddow reports Israeli consulate now twitters. See @israelconsulate for tweets to solve that pesky Middle East problem . . .
India Arie's version of Henley's "Forgiveness" is first rate.
Day 2 of nothing catchy for a status update. Staring to be concerned that I may really be boring after all.
